SUMMARY: NESTED | FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD DETAIL: FIELD | CONSTR | METHOD

com.ace.lewissketch
Class Molecule

java.lang.Object
  com.ace.lewissketch.Molecule
All Implemented Interfaces:
LsConstants
 class Molecule
extends Object
implements LsConstants

A data structure which represents the chemical figure drawn on the canvas of the LewisSketch applet. Basically consists of a list of atoms and a list of bonds that constitute the figure.

getAtomAtPosition

Atom getAtomAtPosition(int mouseX,
                       int mouseY)
Gets the atom at the given point, if the point lies within the "turf" of any atom.

Parameters:
mouseX - X-coordinate of the point
mouseY - Y-coordinate of the point
Returns:
the nearest if the point is in the "turf" of more than one atom, or null if point not in the "turf" of any atom.

reportToNeighborsMoveBegin

void reportToNeighborsMoveBegin(Atom movingAtom)
For all bonds on given atom, report the bond has been deleted to both atoms of the bond. The bond is not actually deleted, but is moving. This method is invoked before the position of the moved atom is changed. reportToNeighborsMoveCompleted() should be invoked after the move. All of this is done to reconfigure octants in the moved atom and its neighbors to which it is bonded.

Parameters:
movingAtom - the atom that is moving

reportToNeighborsMoveCompleted

void reportToNeighborsMoveCompleted(Atom movingAtom)
For all bonds on given atom, report that a bond has finished moving. This method is invoked after the position of the moved atom is changed. All of this is done to reconfigure octants in the moved atom and its neighbors to which it is bonded.

Parameters:
movingAtom - the atom that is moving

recalcBondEndPoints

void recalcBondEndPoints(Atom movingAtom)
For all bonds on given atom, recalculate the endpoints. Used when moving an atom with bonds.

Parameters:
movingAtom - the atom that is moving

recalcAllBondEndPoints

void recalcAllBondEndPoints()
Recalculate the endpoints of all bonds.

bondExistsWithAtoms

boolean bondExistsWithAtoms(Atom atom1,
                            Atom atom2)
Are two atoms bonded?

Parameters:
atom1 - the first atom
atom2 - the second atom
Returns:
true if there's a bond between the atoms

addAutoAtom

Atom addAutoAtom(Atom originAtom,
                 String newName)
Creates a new atom and determines its coordinates relative to an existing atom. This happens when the user is using the BOND tool and simply clicks on an atom....a new atom miraculously appears nearby and is bonded to the one on which they clicked! Returns reference to new atom or null if no new atom created.

Parameters:
originAtom - an existing atom
newName - symbol of the new atom
Returns:
a new atom

drawAll

void drawAll(Graph graphics,
             int mouseX,
             int mouseY)
Draws all bonds and atoms on the given graphic, and highlights atom or bond closest to the given mouse coordinates. The caller may pass negative values for the mouse coordinates if no selected atom or bond is desired.

Parameters:
graphics - drawing of the molecule
mouseX - X-coordinate near an atom or bond to be highlighted
mouseY - Y-coordinate near an atom or bond to be highlighted

drawAll

void drawAll(Graph graphics,
             int[] mouse)
Draws all bonds and atoms on the given graphic, and highlights atom or bond closest to the given mouse coordinates. The caller may pass negative values for the mouse coordinates if no selected atom or bond is desired.

Parameters:
graphics - drawing of the molecule
mouse - coordinates near an atom or bond to be highlighted

clearAtomBonds

void clearAtomBonds(Graph graphics,
                    Atom atom)
Clear (erase) all bonds attached to given atom, as well as periphery of any bonded atoms.

Parameters:
graphics - drawing of the molecule
atom - the atom whose bonds will be erased

scale

void scale(boolean autoCenter)
Scale atom coordinates to fit on window.

Parameters:
autoCenter - whether to center the drawing

reflectY

void reflectY(double aboutY)
Reflect the data image across a line specified by aboutY.

Parameters:
aboutY - the line across which the image should be reflected

placeAllLoneElectrons

void placeAllLoneElectrons()
Force each atom in the atom list to place its electrons.

placeAllLoneElectrons

void placeAllLoneElectrons(double scaleFactor)
Force each atom in the atom list to place its electrons.

Parameters:
scaleFactor - how far away from the atom should the electrons be placed
